item.title: Gamers Are Furious About the Censorship of NSFW Games—and They’re Fighting Back
item.description: As industry groups decry censorship, players are flooding Visa and Mastercard with complaints and sharing the titles of delisted NSFW games to support developers.

item.title: Steam and Itch.io Are Pulling ‘Porn’ Games. Critics Say It's a Slippery Slope to More Censorship
item.description: A conservative group is targeting payment processors as “a weapon” to get adult games deindexed in storefronts. Even games that have nothing to do with sex or abuse have been caught in the dragnet.

item.title: Steam and Itch.io Are Pulling ‘Porn’ Games. Critics Say It's a Slippery Slope to More Censorship
item.description: A conservative group is targeting payment processors as “a weapon” to get adult games deindexed in storefronts. Even games that have nothing to do with sex or abuse have been caught in the dragnet.

item.title: No, of Course You Can't Actually Play the New Lego Game Boy
item.description: A promo video of the new brick-built Nintendo collaboration has some people confused as to what your $60 will buy you.

item.title: A Surprise Pokémon Game Just Dropped for Switch and Mobile
item.description: Pokémon Friends, available now, is a daily puzzle game that lets players untangle yarn to make prizes.

item.title: Life Without Screens: This Camp Is a Teen’s Worst Nightmare
item.description: Hidden burner phones. Hunger strikes. Runaways. The director of a digital detox program for kids spills about how hard it is to tear kids away from their devices.

item.title: This Is the Commodore Comeback Fans Have Waited for—but the Odds Are Still Against It
item.description: After years of mismanagement and questionable product tie-ins, the 80s computer brand is back, now with a fan at the helm. But is the appetite for retro gaming still big enough for it to succeed?

item.title: Italian YouTuber Faces Jail Time for Showing Android Handhelds With Emulated Games
item.description: The games on the devices shown by the content creator may not be entirely legal. That was enough for Italian law enforcement to ding him for “promotion of pirated copyrighted materials.”

item.description: The games on the devices shown by the content creator may not be entirely legal. That was enough for Italian law enforcement to ding him for “promotion of pirated copyrighted materials.”

item.title: This AI Warps Live Video in Real Time
item.description: A startup called Decart has developed an AI model that can transform live footage. The results are mind-bending—and poised to take over streaming.

item.title: Roblox’s New Age Verification Feature Uses AI to Scan Teens’ Video Selfies
item.description: Roblox will scan video selfies of teens to assess their ages as part of a new Trusted Connections feature that gives users access to unfiltered chatting with people they know.

item.description: Razer’s haptic gaming cushion can make your favorite virtual worlds feel real, if you don’t mind the uncomfy seat.
